Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can accurately draw and label a fish within a body of water, correctly showing that fish live in water environments like lakes or oceans.
The student can illustrate and label plants near or in the water, indicating that these are part of the fish's habitat.
The student can show and label water as a necessary resource for the fish, understanding the relationship between the fish and water.
The student can represent other animals in the habitat with some labels, showing the interaction within the ecosystem.
CANNOT: The student might not consistently label all resources the fish needs, such as air, in every drawing instance.

The student may struggle to show or label the complete system interactions, such as how water plants contribute to the habitat, resulting in some missing connections *(incomplete understanding of ecosystem roles)*.
